data.title: Great Ribs
data.text: the BBQ is great, had the ribs, they were nice and tender, will be going back again soon, told the buds about this place, had take out

data.title: A wonderful accident
data.text:
We were headed to another BBQ place and found it closed.  Just happened to spot PaPa's and what a find!  There were 6 of us and we had steaks, ribs and shrimp.  All good and cook like we asked.  My husband & I shared the ribeye and shrimp and it was plenty for the two of us.  The steak was juicy and tender and our friends said the meat almost fell off the rib.

Try this place the next time you want BBQ.

data.title: Great RIbs
data.text: 2 visits now. We hapened across this place when checking out a town to move to from So Cal. I don't know where we will move to but we have a new place to get Q. The first trip was a light lunch on July 4th. We were immediately taken with the aroma. Enough to make a vegan shreek. Wife and I this time split a pulled pork sandwich and onion rings. Both were good and reasonably priced but I had to reserve judgement till I had the ribs. Two day later I made the follow up visit. This time the Smoker was fired up in the parking lot. WoW. Needless to say the ribs were great. cooked perfetly and not smothered in sauce. Jackie had the hot links, again delicious. The sides were good but I bearly noticed. The service on both occasions was prompt and friendly. The Beer Cold. Highly recommended.

data.title: Delicious ribs and margaritas
data.text:
Delicious rib platter I take my daughter to lunch here at least once a week. I love the small town restaurant feel. Old west theme decor. Full bar and friendly bartender. Excellent server from the waiter I wish I would have written down his name to acknowledge him here. Plenty of parking. Definitely worth a try. The only down fall is that they do not have a honey BBQ sauce for the kids. 

Oh they make great salads too!

data.title: PaPa Joe's BBQ
data.text: My bf was working down the street so we met here for a quick lunch.  Service was prompt and very friendly.  Would like to say we had BBQ but..the deep fried shrimp (mine) and shrimp po'boy (his) is what jumped out at us.  The server  joined us in joking about the irony of it. Healthy portion of tasty shrimp and fries.  Next time, we plan on trying the BBQ since it smelled amazing!  There's also a small bar area for those wanting to sip a brew.

data.title: Beef it's what's for dinner.
data.text: Look no further this place has very good beef.  Had a rib eye grilled medium turn out wonderful. I will return. Also had a salad with a side of Tri tip. Very nice. Service good one guy working the bar and tables.

data.title: Horrible leftovers
data.text: Took the family there today. We own a BBQ business and always try different ones when travelling. Walked in the door, was told sit wherever. That's OK. Asked what type of BBQ they served and was told I don't know. I asked is it sweet or vinegar and was told, I don't know, The sauce is in the bottle on your table. Ordered chicken and ribs w/slaw. Well the chicken was yesterdays ad had no flavor at all. The ribs were soggy and tough. This is a very poor excuse for bbq and we will never return. Good thing they make there money from serving beer to the people watching sports on the televisions.

data.title: Good Food
data.text: The food here is good, the service here was good, the prices are on the high side. I got the chicken and the taste was good, I also got the prime rib  on friday and was great, I will go back as the ribs looked good

data.title: Awesome BBQ
data.text: The food was the best BBQ i have had in awhile.  The only downfall is that they don't take debit or credit cards.  They have an ATM on site that charges a fee to remove money.

data.title: High prices, terrible service
data.text: We've eaten here a few times, just to see if things get better and unfortunately they haven't.  While the food is decent, the prices are too high and the service is bad.  They usually have one person at lunch and maybe 2 at dinner waiting tables and they just can't keep up.  Drinks go unfilled, extra napkins have to wait, etc.  Parking is also a bit tight.  I avoid coming here due to these things.

data.title: Way Overpriced
data.text:
We had planned to eat dinner, but the entrees were $25-30.  This is a small bar/restaurant on a main street in downtown Manteca, not Pier 39 in San Francisco.  We ordered sandwiches.  Pulled pork sandwhich and 1 side (I had french fries) was $10.  Appetizers were expensive, but half price during happy hour.

The food was good, the portion generous, the beer cold.  They receive only two stars due to prices. Server was nice.

data.title: HUNGRY FOR BBQ?
data.text: You can tell when you are getting close...the BBQ aroma fills the air. My husband and I just happened to give it a try and we are glad we did. The menu is simple...just flavor-able meat, served with side dishes. But BBQ meat is what they have and if that's what you want, PaPa Joe's BBQ & Steakhouse is the place to go.
